reviews.review_msg: This was a class I picked up because I couldn't get into another GSWS and it ended up being my favourite of the semester! Professor Cohen is such a sweet woman and fantastic lecturer, and she also has a great sense of humour. Classes were a bit heavy on group work (thankfully my group was great!) and you must not skip any readings! Fabulous prof!
She's hardcore.  Has very high expectations of her students.  Expect a lot of hard work!  (Ie. no room for slacking of any sort).  Do not miss any classes!!!

She is a wonderful prof.  My only complaint is that so much of your grade depends on group components and that's not fair to people who want really high grades.  I would rather have been assessed on my own work.  My own work was at a A-A+ range and my group's work was at a B+-A- range, so not really fair.  A lot of reading!!!  A lot of assignments.
Agree with the previous comments.  The course is a lot of hard work and so much reading but you also learn a lot.
Great prof.  A lot of work!!!  Attendance is mandatory due to the set-up of the course.  A lot of group components and presentations.

Very clear, very good prof.  I took Canadian Political Economy course in 1992, and was perhaps the most informative course ever taken in my university career - including my MA. Those who don't like this Prof, are wasting their $$ on education.
All the charm of a stormtrooper. Would look amazing in leather.
